#define NIMU_osalCreateBlockingLock(count, params)   (SemaphoreP_create((count),(params)))
 The macro is used by the I2C driver to create a semaphore for each I2C opened in blocking mode. Semaphores created should initially be created with a count of 0 i.e. unavailable. More...
 
#define NIMU_osalDeleteBlockingLock(X)   (SemaphoreP_delete((X)))
 The macro is used by the I2C driver to delete a previously created semaphore. This is called when a I2C opened in blocking mode is being closed. More...

#define NIMU_osalPendLock(X, Y)   (SemaphoreP_pend((X),(Y)))
 The macro is used by the I2C driver to pend on a semaphore This is called when an application tries to receive data on a blocking when there is no data available. Since all semaphores are initially created to be unavailable; this will cause the application to block. More...

Detailed Description

This is the sample OS Adaptation layer which is used by the MMC driver. The OSAL layer can be ported in either of the following manners to a native OS:

Approach 1:
Use Prebuilt Libraries

  • Ensure that the provide an implementation of all Osal_XXX API for their native OS.
  • Link the prebuilt libraries with their application.
  • Refer to the "example" directory for an example of this
    Pros:
  • Customers can reuse prebuilt TI provided libraries
    Cons:
  • Level of indirection in the API to get to the actual OS call

Approach 2:
Rebuilt Library

  • Create a copy of this file and modify it to directly inline the native OS calls
  • Rebuild the MMC Driver library; ensure that the Include path points to the directory where the copy of this file has been provided.
  • Please refer to the "test" directory for an example of this
    Pros:
  • Optimizations can be done to remove the level of indirection
    Cons:
  • MMC Libraries need to be rebuilt by the customer.
